He was also sentenced to pay $20,000 in fines.</p> <div original-article-post="" origination_station="KDFW" class="big-top article-ct" data-v-3f8abc4c data-v-2899190a><p class="insert-article-type featured-headline" data-v-3f8abc4c>
    Featured
  </p> <div class="insert-wrapper featured-insert-article" data-v-3f8abc4c> <div class="caption" data-v-3f8abc4c> <p data-v-3f8abc4c>Fort Worth Police along with the United States Marshal Service arrested a 16-year-old male juvenile and 21-year-old Anthony Ray Bell-Johnson in connection with the double homicide.</p></div></div></div> <p data-v-2899190a>In September 2022, Bell-Johnson, along with several acquaintances, entered a house on Steel Dust Drive in Fort Worth wearing black masks, firing multiple shots at residents playing in an open garage before fleeing the scene in a vehicle. </p> <p data-v-2899190a>17-year-old Jamerrien Monroe and 5-year-old Rayshard Scott were killed in the shooting. Monroe's 18-month-old son was also injured.</p> <p data-v-2899190a>Police say Bell-Johnson fired his weapon at least 16 times. They later found the keys to the getaway vehicle in Bell-Johnson's pocket, leading to his arrest.</p> <p original-article-post="" origination_station="KDFW" data-v-ec26887a data-v-2899190a>What they're saying:</p> <p data-v-2899190a>Tarrant County assistant district attorneys Bill Vassar and Melina Hogan prosecuted the case.</p> <p data-v-2899190a>"He absolutely knew what he was doing," Vassar told the jury. "This family has been waiting for justice for 3 ½ years. Let's give them some justice."</p> <p original-article-post="" origination_station="KDFW" data-v-ec26887a data-v-2899190a>The backstory:</p> <p data-v-2899190a>Previously, Jay Shawn Nixon-Clark was found guilty of capital murder in Jan. 2025 and automatically sentenced to life in prison for his role in the shooting.</p> <div original-article-post="" origination_station="KDFW" class="big-top article-ct" data-v-3f8abc4c data-v-2899190a><p class="insert-article-type featured-headline" data-v-3f8abc4c>
